Text: In linguistics, a binomial pair or binomial is a sequence of two or more words or phrases belonging to the same grammatical category, having some semantic relationship and joined by some syntactic device such as "and" or "or".

1:
--------------------
<Text: Binomial pair:  Examples in English include "through and through", "(without) let or hindrance", and "chalk and cheese".
